node.text: Welcome to Prosperwind Bank, traveler! The clerks will assist you with mundane deposits, but I regret to inform you that we're currently not in the business of lending out any gold.

option.optiontext: A bank that won't loan? Why is that?
That's fine, I'm not looking for a loan.

node.text: As it happens, I've already loaned out considerable sums of gold to the locals, much of which has contributed to the development of this fair city. But when it comes to repayments, these peasants prefer to adhere to their own schedules instead of what was agreed - I'm stretched to the limit.

option.optiontext: So why not hire a debt collector?

node.text: You see, I've loaned out considerable sums of gold to the locals, but when it comes to repayments, these peasants prefer to adhere to their own schedules instead of what was agreed.
I need a debt collector and you look like a suitably rough type. What do you say?

option.optiontext: Fine, could use the coins - I'll do it.
No thanks, I wouldn't feel comfortable doing your dirty work.

node.text: Greetings, traveler! What a pleasant surprise to see you again. Tell me, have you reconsidered my offer?

option.optiontext: Fine, could use the coins - I'll do it.
What exactly was the offer, again?

node.text: That means he inherently lacks the necessary, um... let's call it an inhibited sense of empathy toward these people, which is sorely needed in this line of work.
You see, I'm sure young Burt is a fantastic lad. But alas, he is one of Haywind's own boys; grew up around here, you know?

But you have the look of a traveler about you and I'm glad to inform you that a new position has just opened up here at our prestigious Prosperwind Bank. What do you say - up for collecting a few debts?

option.optiontext: I could use the coins, I'll do it.
I wouldn't feel comfortable doing your dirty work.

node.text: Splendid! The first debtor on my list is Matilda Cornish - a simple country woman turned city dweller. She has a decent repute, but for some odd reason she turned indignant when I sent Burt to collect payment. See if you'll have better luck?
She lives in her cute, pink little house, westside of the market square, right by the lion statue. Now, I believe there's no reason to get rough with this one, just try to reason with her.
Oh come now, I'd offer you a fair cut! Please reconsider, you'll know where to find me when you do.
A pleasure to see you again, my friend! Any luck collecting the debt from Matilda?

option.optiontext: Where would I find her, again?

node.text: She lives in her cute, pink little house, westside of the market square, right by the lion statue. Now, I believe there's no reason to get rough with this one, just try to reason with her.
A name crossed off my list, then? Most excellent! That'd be the first in some time. This means we can move onto more reluctant customers.

Hmm, let's see here... yes, Beatrice Brier... The young girl acted so grateful when I lent her a sum to spend on a fancy dress. Now that it's time to pay back, she thinks she's treated unfairly. Teach the young brat a lesson in economics, would you?
The Brier family home is located on the SOMEWHERE???
A pleasure to see you again, my friend! Any luck collecting the debt from poor little Beatrice?

option.optiontext: Where would I find her, again?
What was your issue with her anyway?

node.text: The young girl acted so grateful when I lent her a sum to spend on a fancy dress. Now that it's time to pay back, she thinks she's treated unfairly. Teach the young brat a lesson in economics, would you?

option.optiontext: Where would I find her, again?

node.text: The Brier family home is located on the SOMEWHERE???

option.optiontext: What was your issue with her anyway?

node.text: Before you go, I have your cut for a job well done. Continue to work for me and you'll see yourself increasingly well compensated.
Greetings again, traveler! I must say, I'm surprised to see you again. Does this mean you reconsidered my offer?

option.optiontext: Remind me, where was Roberts home again

node.text: A few of these peasants are lacking behind on their loan payments and I need a realiable debt collector. An outsider like you is the perfect hire, so what do you say? I'll give you a fair cut.
How goes your debt collection? Have you talked to Matilda?

option.optiontext: Where do I find her again?

node.text: That is most excellent news, and I have your cut as promised. Next is Robert Riley, you up for it?

option.optiontext: I won't do it again it is far too tedious

node.text: Robert lives in a house in the south of Haywind it has a large apple tree in the garden hes often out there.

option.optiontext: No, I won't be a part of this anymore.

node.text: Up for Robert's debt?
How goes your debt collection? Have you talked to Robert?

option.optiontext: Where do I find him again?

node.text: That is most excellent news, and I have your cut as promised. Next is Beatrice Brier, you up for it?
Up for Beatrice debppt?
Yes, hello dear?
Yes, dear? What is it?

option.optiontext: I'm here to collect the debt you owe to the banker.

node.text: I'm a respectable citizen! All I did was forget to pay, that's all! And now I'm being harassed! I'm not a criminal!

option.optiontext: I really don't care, I'm just here to collect the money and be on my way.

node.text: But you thought it, didn't you?! Didn't you?!?!

option.optiontext: If I could just have the payment and be on my way...

node.text: Don't tell me what to do! I'll pay my debt, but first you have to apologize.
That wasn't so hard now was it, dear? Here's the gold you wanted, and please do give the banker my kind regards.
*Gasp*! That is so rude! You must apologize to me immediately!
How dare you call me ridiculous?! You are a very insulting man, do you know that? I don't feel like paying until I hear a proper apology from you and that's that.

option.optiontext: Ma'am, if you do not pay, I will be forced to hurt you. You don't want that to happen, do you?

node.text: Then I will scream and the guards will come to my rescue and I'll tell them you were trying to rape me. I've dealt with ruffians like you before so don't try to bully me.
No, you have to say it like you mean it.

option.optiontext: I apologize for being so rude, ma'am Cornish.

node.text: Then I don't think we have anything more to discuss.
No, your behavior has caused me terrible upset, that won't do at all! I will agree to pay, but first you must apologize.

option.optiontext: Don't be ridiculous, just pay up.

node.text: So, dear. Are you ready to apologize?

option.optiontext: I will not apologize, you need to pay the debt you owe.

node.text: No, I do not think I will. Not until you apologize to me for all your rude behavior.
Yes, what? What do you want?
Yes I am, so what?

option.optiontext: You owe the banker a debt - I'm here to collect.

node.text: Hah! That dumb boy Burt was here earlier and I can tell you he left empty handed, so good luck with that!

option.optiontext: How about I start by asking nicely? Please, pay up.
Do you think my luck might be helped by threatening to break your legs?

node.text: Hah! Nice try! Tell you what, I have all my gold hidden away in case of bandits like you. So sure you can collect, but you need to find the gold first. Hah! Haha!

option.optiontext: Let's cut the games to where you tell me where to find it.
Okay, that will probably be quicker than trying to talk to you anyway.

node.text: I'm not telling you anything! And you can't make me!
Hah! Nice try! See, I've hidden away all my gold and I'd rather die than tell you where to find it!

option.optiontext: You'd rather die than pay the banker his due? Are you serious?

node.text: It's a matter of principles! It's about standing up to my rights! I won't be pushed around! Yeah, that's right!

option.optiontext: Oh well, I doubt your stash will be hard to find.

node.text: <color=orange> *You find a large coin stash* </color>\nHey! You weren't supposed to find that! You can't do this!
Bah! This is a legal robbery! You're a thief, you know that?!
Hey! You weren't supposed to find that! What are you doing?! You can't take all of it, I don't even owe the banker anywhere near that much!!

option.optiontext: It's for the inconvenience you've caused me.

node.text: I can't let you take that! You'll ruin me!!

option.optiontext: What are you going to do about it?

node.text: This dress makes me look so pretty! Don't I look so pretty?
Ugh, that tone never means anything good. What do you want?

option.optiontext: You owe the banker a debt - I'm here to collect.

node.text: Well, I think that's like your opinion. In my opinion I shouldn't have to pay.

option.optiontext: And whatever makes you think that?
Oh really? Unfortunately my opinion's the only one that matters - pay up!

node.text: It's like... so... well, why should some sweaty old banker get to have more gold? Doesn't he like have enough already?

option.optiontext: Because you borrowed it off of him and it's his gold?
I don't have the patience to argue with a spoilt brat - pay up!

node.text: Yeah, but I spent his gold on this dress, which I totally deserve by the way! But the gold I have now, I earned it myself, so it's my gold.

option.optiontext: Lady, this is getting ridiculous! Pay up before I lose my temper.
That's not how loans work, just pay me and I'll be out of your hair.

node.text: Umm... no.

option.optiontext: Lady... it's the right thing to do and you know it!
Then I'll have to force you to pay.

node.text: Ugh, this is so unfair! Loans are like really stupid! Fine, have your stupid gold and get out!
Don't talk to me like that! You're being mean and I don't have to listen to you!
